Theory of Forms.quote: The forms are perfect, eternal, and unchanging patterns of which particular objects and qualities in the physical world are imperfect copies. (Republic, Book VII)

Cave Allegory.quote: Imagine human beings living in an underground cave... they see only shadows of reality. (Republic, 514a-520a)

Justice.quote: Justice is having and doing what is one's own... when each part of the soul performs its proper function. (Republic, 433a-b)

Philosophical Method.quote: The dialectical method of inquiry proceeds by question and answer to arrive at truth. (Meno)

Education.quote: The direction in which education starts a man will determine his future life. (Republic, 425b-c)

Soul Nature.quote: The soul is tripartite: reason, spirit, and appetite, each with its proper virtue. (Republic, Book IV)

Knowledge.quote: Knowledge is the food of the soul. (Protagoras, 313c)

Love.quote: Love is a serious mental disease... but also the source of our greatest powers. (Phaedrus, 265b)

Political Theory.quote: Until philosophers are kings, or kings have the spirit of philosophy, cities will never cease from ill. (Republic, 473d)

Reality.quote: What is real is rational and what is rational is real. (Republic, Book VI)

Beauty.quote: Beauty lies in the eye of the beholder... but true beauty is eternal and unchanging. (Symposium)

Virtue.quote: Virtue is knowledge, and those who know the good will do the good. (Meno, 87c)

Immortality.quote: The soul is immortal and imperishable, and our souls will truly exist in another world. (Phaedo, 106e)

Teaching Method.quote: I cannot teach anybody anything, I can only make them think. (Attributed to Plato)

Divine Nature.quote: God is the measure of all things, not man as some say. (Laws, 716c)

Poetry.quote: Poetry is nearer to vital truth than history. (Ion)

Mathematics.quote: Let no one ignorant of geometry enter here. (Inscription at the Academy)

Wisdom.quote: The beginning of wisdom is the definition of terms. (Attributed to Plato)

Government.quote: The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men. (Republic)

Human Nature.quote: Man is a being in search of meaning. (Republic)

Art.quote: Art is the imitation of an imitation, as it copies the physical world, which itself is a copy of the world of forms. (Republic, Book X)

Ethics.quote: Good people do not need laws to tell them to act responsibly, while bad people will find a way around the laws. (Republic)

Truth.quote: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light. (Attributed to Plato)

Learning.quote: All learning has an emotional base. (Republic)

Justice System.quote: Justice means minding one's own business and not meddling with other men's concerns. (Republic, 433a)

Philosopher King.quote: The philosopher is in love with truth, that is, not with the changing world of sensation, but with the unchanging reality. (Republic)

Social Order.quote: The city is what it is because our citizens are what they are. (Republic)

Dialectic.quote: Dialectic is the art of asking questions that expose contradictions in conventional beliefs. (Republic)

Educational Theory.quote: Do not train children to learning by force and harshness, but direct them to it by what amuses their minds. (Republic)

Political Justice.quote: The greatest penalty for declining to rule is to be ruled by someone inferior to yourself. (Republic, 347c)
